phrase.item: Once the king Iskandar ordered that those who turned seventy should be fed with seven days worth of food and then must be buried alive.
People were forced to follow his command.
After several years an interesting event happened.
There was a golden saddle on top of a mountain rock, and it was reflected in a lake.
That lake was next to the mountain rock.
Iskandar ordered, "Take that golden thing out of the lake!"
Then everyone took a turn and entered the lake, but the lake was very deep and whoever entered drowned.
Every day a person entered that lake and disappeared.
At the time when Iskandar had ordered all elders to be buried alive, there was an old man and his children hid him.
Then their turn came, they went to their father to hold his hand [a greeting].
They said, "Our turn has come to [jump] in the lake."
"What should we do?"
Their father became aware of this situation and told his children: "The gold is not inside the lake."
"It is on top of the mountain rock and is reflected in the water."
"You should take a rifle with you, when you see [the gold] then you should shoot it loose"
Not sure what qerawɨl exactly means: security, doorman, housing.
The children listened to their father and did what he said.
The mountain rock was very high.
They saw the saddle and shot it loose.
The saddle fell from the mountain rock.
They brought the golden saddle to king Iskandar.
Iskandar was surprised and asked, "How come all these people couldn't find it and died, but you found it?"
The boys replied, "If you forgive us, we will tell you."
Iskandar said, "I have forgiven you."
The boys said, "When you ordered [us] to bury all old men, we hid our father, with his admonishments and guidance we found the saddle."
Iskandar was very thankful to their father and gave them some goods.
For that reason it is said:
Don't go without [the guidance of elders] or you will be behind [fail],
Even if you are the Iskandar of the time.
